definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which build desolate places for themselves;
sentences.chinese: 和地上为自己重造荒邱的君王，谋士。

sentences.english: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
sentences.chinese: 他把谋士剥衣掳去，又使审判官变成愚人。

sentences.english: In fact, besides the apparent cause of the opportune, the talents, especially the advisors had a pivotal role in the Three Kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 谋士集团在三国鼎立中有着举足轻重的作用。
亚希多弗也作王的谋士。

sentences.english: Because war is managed by due ordering: and there shall be safety where there are many counsels.
sentences.chinese: 因为作战须有智谋，胜利在于谋士众多。

sentences.english: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and makes the judges fools.
sentences.chinese: 他把谋士剥衣掳去，又使审判官变成愚人。

sentences.english: In the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
Duke Chao admired him so much that he game him a job as an advisor.
sentences.chinese: 鲁昭公很赞赏他，让他担当谋士。

sentences.english: Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子撒迦利亚是精明的谋士，掣签守北门。

definition: Xun Yu (163-212), brilliant strategist, advisor of Cao Cao in Three Kingdoms
Cheng Yu (141-220), advisor to General Cao Cao 曹操 during the Three Kingdoms era
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
